column5: here is a bad picture from my nightly smoke break a 100 miles offshore in the gulf of mexico,  as i sit and puff away on my marlbough light. this what i get  to watch with frustration and dreams of being able to cast a line. unfortunatley it is not allowed to fish from the vessel. as the fishing line gets in the thruster seals and its a multi-million dollar fix.   theres hundreds of tarpon out here rolling from dusk till dawn chowing on shrimp and flying fish.  i can only dream of belize and nicuragua tarpon.
Cool! What are you doing out there?  S.

i work on this bad boy , its a heavy lift construction vessel .  our present scope of work is installing and hammering in place oil platform jackets in the mexican waters of the gulf f mexico. the large crane has a lifting  capacity of 1,600 tonnes.  accomadation  of crew members is 296 when maxed out.  theres four meals a day on here and the galley never closes 24 hour a day working operations.
Sounds like some interesting work out there in the Gulf.
